interface.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Media.SessionHandler

method.name: Error
method.tp:docstring: THIS METHOD IS DEPRECATED AND SHOULD NOT BE USED. Instead the Error function should be used on the relevant MediaStreamHandler objects. Informs the connection manager that an error occured in this session. If used, the connection manager must terminate the session and all of the streams within it, and may also emit a StreamError signal on the channel for each stream within the session.

signal.name: NewStreamHandler

arg.name: stream_handler
arg.tp:docstring: An object path to a new MediaStreamHandler

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: The unique ID of the new stream

arg.name: media_type
arg.tp:docstring: Enum for type of media that this stream should handle (a value from MediaStreamType)

arg.name: direction
arg.tp:docstring: Enum for direction of this stream (a value from MediaStreamDirection)

signal.tp:docstring: Emitted when a new stream handler has been created for this session.

method.name: Ready
method.tp:docstring: Inform the connection manager that a client is ready to handle this session handler.

interface.tp:docstring: An media session handler is an object that handles a number of synchronised media streams.
